page.title: 11Towan Farm
page.content: Towan Farm is situated two miles south of St.Austell on the Pentewan road it was originally a tenented farm belonging to the Carlyon Estate. The farm is approximately 210 acres(87 hectares) and most of the land lies over 300ft (91metres) above sea level. The farm is organised as a livestock farm with dairy cattle and beef cattle .Arable land is used to grow fodder crops for the animals.Fodder crops include barley,hay and silage. There are 104 friesian dairy cattle altogether and 104 bullocks.The dairy cattle milked between 7.00 and 9.00 in the morning and between 4.30 and 5.30 in the afternoon.The milk is taken to Lostwithiel Creamery by bulk tanker. The farm is mechanised and three men do all the work.
